author: Lorne Mason and Jonathan Baxter and Peter L. Bartlett and Marcus Frean
title: Boosting Algorithms as Gradient Descent
window: These results show that DOOM II generally outperforms AdaBoost and that the improvement is more pronounced in the presence of label noise. -2 -1.5 -1 -0.5 0 0.5 1 1.5 2 2.5 3 3.5 Error advantage (%) Data set sonar cleve ionosphere vote1 credit breast-cancer pima-indians hypo1 splice 0% noise 5% noise 15% noise Figure 1: Summary of test error advantage (with standard error bars) of DOOM II over AdaBoost
